pageTitle: Stoke City - Riggott signs on loan for Potters
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {18789=Date:Saturday March 1 2008, 11349=Afellay undergoing Stoke medical (Monday July 27 2015), 10960=Stoke lose to Brentford as they travel to Evian (Saturday July 25 2015), 9934=Who should replace Nzonzi in the deep lying playmaker role? (Monday July 13 2015), 10138=FSF Urge Clubs To Reduce Away Ticket Prices (Friday July 17 2015), 10750=Hughes to finally capture Barcelona's Traore (Saturday July 25 2015), 10544=Bojan returns in Brentford friendly (Saturday July 25 2015), 11156=Stoke transfer window- Goalkeepers (Saturday July 25 2015), 11539=Afellay completes Stoke switch (Monday July 27 2015), 21520=Stoke have picked up defender, Chris Riggott on loan from Middlesbrough for the remainder of the season. Riggott was a stalwart of the Boro defence after he joined from Derby in 2001, but has failed to make an impact in the first team for the last couple of seasons under Gareth Southgate. The 27 year old will help bolster a Potters' defence that has been leaking too many goals compared to a traditional Pulis tight back four but that has been compensated by a free scoring attack. Whilst we would not expect either Griffin, Cort or Shawcross to have to make way for Riggott, there's now doubt that extra cover in defence will benefit the squad should we get any suspensions or injuries in the final run in. The club have also revealed that the planned loan move of keeper, Carlo Nash to Stoke has had to be put on hold after Wigan's Chris Kirkland picked up a knock in training. Pulis is still hopefully of the deal finally going through some time next week., 18745=Time: 1:27PM, 11738=Bachmann moves to Ross County on loan (Tuesday July 28 2015), 10346=Stoke could break transfer record for Yarmolenko (Sunday July 19 2015)}
